engine

Class Search

  • java.lang.Object
    • engine.Search

  •  class Search
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides implementations of the various search algorithms from the Graph Toolkit class, including BFS, DFS, Topological Sort, and Floyd-Warshall.

        private Search()

    • Method Detail

      • bfs

        static java.util.List<Node> bfs(Graph g,
                       Node src,
                       Node tgt,
                       boolean flow)
        A BFS Implementation to find the shortest path from src to tgt. Since this is BFS, the shortest path is in terms of length, not weights.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graph
        src - the node to start BFS from
        tgt - the node to end BFS at
        flow - whether or not this is BFS on a flow graph
        Returns:
        the shortest path from src to tgt.

      • dfs

        static java.util.Map<Node,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> dfs(Graph g,
                                                        Node src)
        function performs DFS on given graph and returns a map of Nodes in graph to a list of integers. The list contains a start time and a finish time for each Node.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graph
        src - the Node to start DFS
        Returns:
        a mapping of start and finish times for each node

      • topSort

        static java.util.List<Node> topSort(Graph g)
        Function performs a topological sort on the vertices of a given graph by performing DFS and arrange vertices by descending finish times.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graph
        Returns:
        a topological sort of the vertices in the graph.

      • floydWarshall

        static java.util.Map<Node,java.util.Map<Node,java.lang.Double>> floydWarshall(Graph g)
        Finds all-pairs shortest paths by implementing the Floyd-Warshall algorithm
        Parameters:
        g - the input graph
        Returns:
        a map representing the all-pairs shortest path matrix

      • checkInDegree

        private static boolean checkInDegree(Node n,
                    java.util.Set<Node> graph)
        Check if n has in degree
        Parameters:
        n - the node to check
        graph - the graph containing the node
        Returns:
        true if in degree == 0, false otherwise

      • getUnvisited

        private static Node getUnvisited(java.util.Set<Node> graph,
                java.util.Set<Node> visited)
        Given a set of nodes in a graph and a set of visited nodes, function returns an unvisited node of zero In degree. If there are no nodes of zero in degree in remaining connected component, returns arbitrary unvisited node
        Parameters:
        graph - the set of nodes of a Graph
        visited - a set of discovered nodes
        Returns:
        a node with zero in degree. If such a node does not exist then return the first unvisited node encountered.

      • stamp

        private static java.util.Map<Node,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> stamp(java.util.Map<Node,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> map,
                                                          Node n,
                                                          int i)
        Given a map, a node, and an int, function adds int to the set of integers mapped by the given node. Helper function for dfs and cycle detection.
        Parameters:
        map - current time stamp maps
        n - Node to be stamped
        i - integer to stamp node with
        Returns:
        a map time stamps with given node stamped with given integer.

      • detectCycle

        private static boolean detectCycle(Graph g)
        function returns a boolean checking if given graph contains a cycle. Returns true if there exists a cycle.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graph
        Returns:
        true if there is a cycle and false otherwise
